title: Quiz 8: Data Collection & Quality
description: Assess your understanding of data collection methods, instrument design, and ensuring data quality through pilot studies.

questions.question: Which data collection method uses a group of 5-15 people to generate dialogue and opinions simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Focus groups leverage group interaction to generate data.

questions.question: Match the data collection instrument to its description:
questions.explanation: Interview schedules are oral; Observation watches; Key informants are experts; Records are secondary data.

questions.question: What are the advantages of reviewing existing records (secondary data)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Can cover a long period of time
The researcher can control how data was originally collected

questions.explanation: Existing records save resources and reduce respondent effect, but the researcher has NO control over original collection quality.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ study is a small version of the proposed study conducted to refine methodology and test instruments before the full study.
questions.explanation: A pilot study (or pre-test) is a trial run to identify problems.

questions.question: Why is it important to train interviewers?

options.text: To prevent bias and ensure consistent data collection
To give them something to do
To allow them to change the questions as they see fit
To make the research look more expensive

questions.explanation: Training ensures all interviewers ask questions and record answers in the same standard way, reducing bias.

questions.question: Ideally, a pre-test should be conducted AFTER the main data collection to check for errors.
questions.explanation: False. A pre-test MUST be done BEFORE the main study to correct errors in the tools or procedure.

questions.question: Which of the following are purposes of a pilot study? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Assess time taken to administer instruments

questions.explanation: Pilot studies check feasibility, design, and timing. They do not collect the final data.

questions.question: Order the stages of data collection:
questions.explanation: Get permission -> Collect data -> Handle/Store -> Enter into computer.

questions.question: What effect refers to subjects changing their behavior simply because they know they are being observed?
questions.explanation: The Hawthorne effect is a form of reactivity/bias in observational studies.
questions.hint: Named after a famous factory experiment.

questions.question: When allocating tasks for data collection, what is the first step?

options.text: List the tasks that have to be carried out

questions.explanation: You must first list what needs to be done before you can assign people or time to it.
